etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘the action of perfuming’): from Latin fumigatio(n-), from the verb fumigare, from fumus ‘smoke’

definitions: the action or process of disinfecting or purifying an area with the fumes of certain chemicals

examples.text: the students are part of an effort to eliminate mosquitoes through fumigation

shortDefinitions: action of disinfecting area with fumes
